Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as a form of thought policing and an imposition of government-defined truth.
There is a lack of trust in the government to not misuse the powers granted by the legislation.
The legislation is viewed as a tool to silence dissent and opposition.
Historical examples of suppressed truths are cited to argue against government control over information.
The legislation is perceived as a means for the government to maintain control over the populace.
Notable Quotes: I never thought I would live in a country that employed thought police.
Absolute power corrupts absolutely has never been more true and this is a rung on that ladder.
Australia will be lost if this Communistic tool comes into effect.
